p: In the 1980s, cases of biochemical abnormalities, including hyperosmolarity, lactic acidosis and elevated levels of creatinine and bilirubin, were documented after exposure to 3 g/day of PG and for at least 5 consecutive days. Clinical symptoms, including seizures and bradycardia episodes [ 33], then appeared. In 2011, the U.S. FDA reported health problems in premature new-borns associated with the use of Kaletra Â® (lopinavir/ritonavir) solution; liquid preparation containing high amounts of PG and ethanol [ 33, 34].
